website_summaries.verdict: An officially licensed charging station that delivers a terrific combination of quality and affordability.
pros: Charging time of about 2.2 hours ensures you won't have to wait too long to recharge your controllers
Includes a handy LED indicator light so you can check the status of your charge at any time
Compatible with Xbox One S, Xbox One and Xbox One Elite controllers
Comes with two battery packs for added convenience
cons: Putting a controller into the station can be difficult and will require you to push down hard on the controller

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is the first non-OEM rechargeable batteries that I have bought for my controllers. I am not impressed. The batteries drain quickly and the controller shuts off without triggering a low battery warning on screen. I've not even had these batteries for a month yet and they are preforming sub-par already. I would not recommend this product to anyone. The batteries do take a charge and fit in my controller perfectly but the play time is very low (roughly 1.5-2 hrs.) and that just doesn't work for me. It is not fun en-gauging in a battle just to have your character stop moving and get killed by npc's or other players due to a dead battery.
customer_reviews.author: EN

customer_reviews.title: 1battery dead 1yr warranty not being fulfilled  UPDATE 2 dead & under 1yr warranty CS no response
customer_reviews.text: One battery has already quit charging. Just flashes red. Hasn’t even been a year and it says it has a year warranty. Contacted amazon about the warranty through the proper channels and still no replacement. Go oem I guess. Update. Now the second remote has stopped charging and flashes red. Still under the year warranty and contacted customer service again since they did not respond to my previous email. Waiting to see if they stand by their product or not. I will update.
customer_reviews.author: Chris and Trish

customer_reviews.title: Does not support charging standalone battery
customer_reviews.text: I have one controller. This unit came with two batteries. I wanted to charge both batteries (one installed into the controller and the other not) at the same time. Unit does not seem to support charging a battery outside of the controller. I need to charge one battery at a time using the controller to hold the battery in place on the charging unit.
customer_reviews.author: JRO

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: As the batteries drain the controllers disconnect more and more frequently. Annoying during game play. Not the greatest battery life either. Also the battery packs fit two of my controllers but not the third. All three are Microsoft brand so I'm not sure what the difference is.
customer_reviews.author: Marly Seeley

customer_reviews.title: Superb product that is easy to use and dependable
customer_reviews.text: Finally was able to get my kid away from continually using batteries and using this charger. Don't get me wrong, I had tried other chargers in the past, but they were either shoddy workmanship and did not last the test of time, or he just wasn't interested in using them because they didn't communicate in a way that indicated that the charger was working or was complete. This one does it all, and he loves it. No more batteries and throwing them away - we are finally environmentally friendly!
customer_reviews.author: jonathan held

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, though sometimes needs a few attempts to seat the controller
customer_reviews.text: This is a no frills charger that does what it's supposed to. The batteries were easily swapped into the controllers and maintain plenty of charge so far. My only gripe would be that you sometimes have to wriggle the controllers a bit to get them situated and in contact for charging. You can see when they are seated correctly as the light will illuminate. The green light is very bright so there is no question when the charge is complete. Overall this worked just as well as my Nyko charger I used for my xbox 360, though admittedly, it is a bit less weighty/solid feeling.
customer_reviews.author: DesertRat

customer_reviews.title: Decent charger, one annoyance.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to do but there's one area which is seriously in need of improvement. The cord is way too short. A 6' cord would have been nice, but instead we've got just under 3'. Not quite enough to reach the outlet from the surface of my desk. Every other device on my desk has what I'd consider a normal length cord at or around 6'. So now I've either got to get an extension cord for this thing, or sit it weirdly on a far ledge of my desk where it's closer to an outlet. Doesn't break the product by any means, but man is it ever annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Nice charger
customer_reviews.text: I had a super cheap charger for our controllers until it broke. I wasn’t going for anything flashy but decided on this and I really love it. The color indicator is great. I do wish there was a way to charge with the chat pad on, but we’re getting better at taking that off and installing it.
customer_reviews.author: singhsongs

customer_reviews.title: One side was DOA - flashing red light.
customer_reviews.text: One side of the charger worked fine. The second side would only flash red. There is NO DOCUMENTATION about what a flashing red light means. After digging through multiple reviews on several sites, turns out it means faulty charger. Both batteries worked on the good side, but not at all on the bad side. This was straight out of the sealed box! I would understand if it failed after at least a few days of use, but this was DOA. Disappointing, as I really liked the look of it. Returned it. Ordered the Energizer one (as I have one for my Wii U nunchucks, and it's been solid for 4 years now).
customer_reviews.author: BusaSpectre

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, but came in broken.
customer_reviews.text: Came in as described but both tabs on the covers for the batteries were broken. They will not stay on unless taped down. Submitting a claim on amazon to see if they will replace them. Will update if they do. Update: Called Amazon support. Sent one out that day, arrived two days later.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Works well, and charges alright. Only complaint is ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well, and charges alright. Only complaint is that it is challenging to get the remotes to sit correctly onto the dock. If not in correctly, they don't charge (obviously). So we have resorted into placing a heavy book on top to make sure they don't pop off charge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cut down on battery cost and buy this now!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my controllers charged and the batteries on these things last for a long time. Haven't run out of battery yet even during 7-8 hour or longer gaming sessions. Just pop it back on the charger at night when you're done. Doesn't take up much space on my shelf and Amazon Basics always makes quality products!
customer_reviews.author: RAM

customer_reviews.title: Horrible design
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very odd. The controllers don’t sit well/easily into this, and it also has some weird click system. Not sure why you would ever wanna put a controller in here and click it like a ball point pen, so it doesn’t charge. Also doesn’t fit controllers with any chat adapters on them. This thing is just trash.
customer_reviews.author: DuckJ13

customer_reviews.title: Not sure of the durability since a charge indicator went out. Sensitive to controller placement.
customer_reviews.text: One side of the charger has non-functioning indicators and it's VERY sensitive to placement. However, it's still working and it's WAY less hassle than finding batteries. The kids now have the responsibility of charging the controllers. Forget to do it and they die early? Too bad! Nice little lesson in managing responsibilities. But, as I said, it's kinda sensitive and the power cable is a little short so...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's fine from a usability standpoint but I have to either ...
customer_reviews.text: As a battery pack it works well and recharges quickly. The only problem I have is with the battery case used to enclose it in the controller as both seem to not completely lock in anymore in two of my controllers. It's fine from a usability standpoint but I have to either put it in a different controller to charge it or mess around with it to make it for well enough the charger portion of the battery sticks through. If not for that it would be 4 to 4.5 stars as it is a good deal on a product that works.
customer_reviews.author: E. Malone

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and consistent charging
customer_reviews.text: It took me a little bit to figure out how the charger worked and I was convinced at first that it was broken. It works now like a charm, my and my son's controllers stay charged up so we never have to worry about our batteries suddenly going dead in the middle of PVP (because it's always during PVP that batteries decide to die). It does take a little bit of shoving and manipulation of the rechargeable battery to get them in place in the controller - it seems like the designer used the maximum possible dimensions they were allowed for the batteries - but once you do get them in there, it works pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great charging deck!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty awesome. When you are done charging you can press the housing up and it stops charging the controller cause it no longer makes contact. This is great cause you don't over charge your batteries and you still have a place to place your controllers neatly.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Hunawill

customer_reviews.title: unnaturally short usage time
customer_reviews.text: My usual rechargeable batteries go 2 weeks in my two controllers. I've used various brands of rechargeable batteries for over a decade. "These" last less than 2 days when fully charged. . I've set them continuously on the charger between uses. I've set them on this charger base "just" when my XboxOne states the batteries are low. I've re-seated them inside the controllers, used different power strip and electrical outlet on another breaker. Not very happy with this product. I don't have the box or this would've been sent back already.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the price. It does have you "click" your controller on which can be kind of frustrating cause you push your controller down and end up push the buttons or joysticks and then it sometimes doesn't connect right away. Also the light that signals if it is charging or fully charged is very bright, and as somebody who keeps in their bedroom, but can't stand having any form of lights on while they sleep, it is very annoying (I cover with a blanket).
customer_reviews.author: Teacherwithabudget

customer_reviews.title: Great charging system
customer_reviews.text: Got these for the Xbox One controllers as the kids would run through batteries. Someone said that it was a tight fit but its the fact that you can only insert the battery a certain way. There's a light display to show you whether the battery is charged or not. Have to make sure you push down on the controller until it clicks.
customer_reviews.author: Dache B.

customer_reviews.title: I have to adjust the controllers slightly to get them to make good contact with the base to charge
customer_reviews.text: Works well, however, I have to adjust the controllers slightly to get them to make good contact with the base to charge. Quick charge and the batteries have held up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Alwaysridin88

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: They work for about 8 hours, this is good. Putting them in the charging station is a challenge. It takes me ten minutes of playing with it moving it back and forth, up and down so the light comes on. It is so frustrating. I would not recommend this product for anyone. POS.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Saving $$$! Not buying batteries anymore
customer_reviews.text: Kids were going they 30 batteries every month or two Bought this and now no more having to buy batteries My boys popped out the old batteries Popped in the new rechargeable unit and off they went- At night they place their controllers on the stand and they are ready to go again next am-
customer_reviews.author: Coastie

customer_reviews.title: Amazon does it again.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best charger I’ve used for all the different video game handsets I’ve have used. Two lite charging ports, red for charging, green for charged, and none once charged. Comes of course with rechargeable batteries so it won’t take long to pay for is self. FYI I spend 8hrs plus on Saturday’s playing and it won’t runout of charge. Have not noticed how long it takes to get a full charge but I assume quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Bonemouth

customer_reviews.title: Eventually starts going downhill
customer_reviews.text: Had this thing for at least a couple years, it worked well in that time. But for the last few months the charge wouldn't last very long so my controllers were dying quicker, and when I would put them on the charger it would flash red until I messed with it and got it to stop. I don't know what that meant but I know it wasn't charging while that was happening. I figure these don't last forever, or the batteries certainly don't, so I bought some different rechargeable batteries. Probably gonna chuck this thing since it doesn't really work well anymore. But, it did for a while so it was a good product, just not forever.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: Works as I'd hoped; a bit quirky but good value
customer_reviews.text: Took a minute to realize the battery goes in only one way (battery pack). You have to push down when controller is in cradle, to turn on a switch in the cradle to charge. That is the quirky part...not realizing there is a switch. OTherwise, it is working, and we've used it for about a week. Hope this keeps me from spending a bunch on batteries, as we use the xbox 1 for both gaming and netflix/hulu/amazon TV. This means it's on daily for many hours...and batteries go quick.
customer_reviews.author: mlee98

customer_reviews.title: Works great, the only reason for 4 stars and not ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, the only reason for 4 stars and not 5 is that when you place controller in the charger you have to push the cradle down to lock into the charger position, which is a little tricky sometimes. Charges fast and love the colored light change when controller is fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Albrecht

customer_reviews.title: Nope...
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a fan of this charging station at all. I’ve had other charging stations where I don’t constantly have to be pushing the thing down or whatever to charge. And they have lasted a very long time. Only reason I tried the Amazon one was because they’re aren’t carrying the other brand. Especially when you have kids and a wife and need to depend on everyone to put them on the base correctly. I’ve had this just a few months and will be replacing it already.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: No more cables!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit OCD about my desk area where my Xbox One is currently setup and i hated having the old charger cables cluttering up the desk. Takes a couple tries getting used to docking these, but the LED indicators let you know once it's seated properly and looks great sitting right on top of the console. Battery life isn't as great as the official batteries, but the ease and convenience of docking the controller makes up for the slightly shortened battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Silicon Forest Entertainment

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after my power A charging station gave out. I love how long the batteries last, i can charge them to full once and they'll last me 3 to 4 days before needing another charge. I normally play 3-4 hours a day after work so its great. Plus this works with my old power A battery packs, so now i have 4 controllers ready to be charged on one great charging station. Ive tried many charging stations before and this is one of the best ive own. For the price and quality its well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Fenrir

customer_reviews.title: cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap quality production. They are clunky to get to initiate charging when you push down to "activate". I wish they were like some others that have the ability to charge the second battery while out of the controller. I only have and need 1 controller, so the other battery has to be swapped out in order to charge. Has a LED to indicate charge status but no way of telling how long it will take or anything even in the packaging to indicate this.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. They charge quick and the rechargeable batteries they come with last a LONG time. I play RPGs and Sports games so I need a long battery life and these definitely do the trick. I also love how you press the charging stand in to charge them and press them again to pop up. In the up position, this serves as a controller stand as well. The green and red lights around the base tells you when it's ready to go and it's bright so I can see it from other rooms if I just poke my head in to check the status.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: No More Batteries
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this product. Not sure about your kids, but mine seem to have an issue with putting used batteries into the container we have for them. You could find dead batteries on the floor and in the couch and on tables. The problem was you constantly were testing all the batteries because new ones got mixed in with the old. Frustrating. Now, I don;t buy as many batteries and if they don't place the controllers on the charger they don't play. Funny how they never forget to do that!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh! They work but are a pain.
customer_reviews.text: Look these do the job but they are super finicky. The controller has to be on it just right or it wont charge. If someone bumps the table or whatever this is sitting on it can knock it off of charge. Just straight up poor design. I expected better but at the end of the day it does charge the controllers. I dont know if other brands are better or worse. I will be keeping them and using them but knowing what I know now I would probably of bought a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Starts to fall apart after a few months
customer_reviews.text: At first this worked like a charm, aside from the short cord and specificity with which you have to balance your controller, it was pretty solid. After a few months the light stopped changing to green when charged and just kept pumping power to the batteries making them extremely hot. After about 9 months one of the batteries doesn't keep my controller on (like a short is causing it to constantly disconnect) it even hard crashed a game I was playing somehow. I'd recommend a hard wired controller but Microsoft doesn't really offer that so I guess we just keep replacing our subpar chargers and suck it up \Oo/
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Controller doesn't fit perfectly, but good overall.
customer_reviews.text: Problems with getting the controller to sit correctly on the charger. It can be annoying thinking you're charging your controllers overnight and wake up to find that it was never charging. To me, the battery packs are hard to switch into other controllers. But, it's a good charging station overall and I would recommend for the average gamer. EDIT: Had this charger for roughly 1.5 years. Still charges well, with the occasional red flashing light while charging. The battery life seems to drain a little bit quicker, but will still hold a charge for 4 hours on average. I definitely prefer this over any wired charger, as those never seem to last long for me.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: works as expected
customer_reviews.text: It works fine with one controller on but the second one on doesn't want to work about half the time. I have to wiggle it to get the connection and if I don't bump it then it stays on. I think it could be the battery pack and cover for the controller. I have struggled to get the battery and cover to close properly on one of the controllers. My daughter has had the same issue with hers, but my son's seems to have no issues although his is a different brand. (it looks exactly the same)
customer_reviews.author: Thomas D. Tippets

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: We love the way that the controller mounts to this charger, we had one we originally got from a big box store and it was junk and only lasted for a few weeks before one side stopped working and they would not honor a replacement. This one is sleek, easy to read, charges fast, reasonably priced and doesn't need to be jammed into the port for charging which is great in our opinion. I highly recommend this charging station!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Singer

customer_reviews.title: It breaks the controllers that are pricey to replace.
customer_reviews.text: It broke both my Xbox controllers after about 6 months. I guess it over charges the batteries or something but they’re both dead and I’m super annoyed I have to replace both the controllers because they are in perfect shape other than using this dual charging station. Save your money and avoid the hassle. I had to give it 1 star but it derseves zero.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great charger but need 2 hands
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this long, but so far it's a great charger. It's a little flimsily made and you need 2 hands (one on each side of the controller) to push down the controller bed to activate the charging, but I can deal with that. It's really easy to tell when it's done charging because it goes from a big red glow to a big green glow. The fully charged batteries last for a good 2 days with each day a full day-long marathon with the vibration being used (uses more power) and no headset (which sucks even more power).
customer_reviews.author: Scarlytt

customer_reviews.title: Mine didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a while. Never played comic much but used the controller for PC. Out of the blue, the unit started getting very hot and wouldn't go green. Still charged the batteries but would stay red. Tested to see if the up/down switch for charge or rest was the issue. Still got insanely hot on packs when up. Disappointing to say the least. Others are fine but this one has an issue.
customer_reviews.author: John Kubler IV

customer_reviews.title: Very bright charging lights, But GREAT charging station.
customer_reviews.text: Great charging station. I waited to review so I could see if the barriers would hold up. They have so far it’s been over a month. They charge super fast and last days worth of heavy use. I just wish the red/green lights weren’t SO bright. It literally is like a night night. I just take them off the charger now once I see it turn green because I can’t handle how bright the lights are at night.
customer_reviews.author: tmarti08

customer_reviews.title: Little finnicky on the controller, dock fit. But work well
customer_reviews.text: Work well to charge. Batteries and new covers for well. I do wish the base/controller fit was a bit less finnicky. Me and my kids both have put controllers on charge only to come back later and they not have charged. When placing controllers on dock make sure to wiggle the or whatever it takes to make the charge light come on. Just pressing them on and walking away works about 50% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Family

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to use and the batteries seem to hold plenty of charge after a couple years, but the charging base has serious design/manufacturing issues. On our second base after the first one had issues in just 5 months, the second is now exhibiting the same issues after a bit more than a year. The lights indicating charge either are completely off, or they stay red indefinitely (including when there is no controller charging, which is not normal). Eventually, the base stops charging the controllers on one or both sides. Never had a problem with any other Amazon Basics product before, but this is definitely one to avoid. Maybe that's why it's currently unavailable...
customer_reviews.author: Moose Nuts

customer_reviews.title: I would look for something of better quality.
customer_reviews.text: It's like an Amazon Chinese made charger. It says Amazon on the charger. I can only change one controller at a time, the other charging port doesn't work. You have to balance the controller on the charger just right in order for it to charge. I definitely would not recommend it to anyone. Just more Chinese junk. I give it 2 stars because it does kind of work. It's not what I paid for. Just look for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: 1+ year edit: No longer does the job.
customer_reviews.text: 18 months out - 1 battery will not charge. the other is weak. They are impossible to get on the stand, and it just flashes red until they're fixed but the lightest bump pushes them off the stand again. It also blocks the bottom port, which I'm worried will wear out my chat adapter from plugging it in over and over. You can NOT charge these with a cable. You can NOT charge these when the controller isn't attached - so no "spare" battery support.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Myers

customer_reviews.title: It’s fine...
customer_reviews.text: Overall I’d say it’s fine for the money. My only really gripe is how finicky it is to get the controllers correctly seated in place. Sometimes it will be fine, but 30 seconds later it changes it’s mine and starts flashing. The battery packs also fit MUCH tighter than OEM battery packs do, which I’m not sure is concerning or not.
customer_reviews.author: C. Huebner

customer_reviews.title: Does good with one flaw, after several months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Batteries are decent, decent use time etc, recharge time, one problem is that when seating the batteries in the controller onto the actual charging station, have mto wigle it and what not to just get it right on there, silly, sometimes playing with it for a minute or two to just have get it seated. As time goes on, it seems to get harder and harder and now at around 5 months of having them it's even harder, they now charge fine after wrigling them on there, then after 30 seconds to a couple of minutes, they sometimes flash red light and not charge, reposition them again, like a tempermental baby, nonstop attention every 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: chadwick

customer_reviews.title: No steals my batteries anymore
customer_reviews.text: Tired of having children stealing your batteries? this was the answer to my problem! The battery pack is made specifically for the Xbox controller, fits both Elite controller and regular controller (i have both and now use it on both!) Don't have to continuously take the batteries off the controller every night and put it in the charger then return every night to see that my children have taken the batteries for their remote controlled toys. Place the controller on the charger directly and it charges it. Also great way to house the controllers for storage when not playing. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Siqueira

customer_reviews.title: More like 3.5 stars
customer_reviews.text: So these aren't terrible. They get the job done. But after 1.5 years, the batteries barely last a couple hours if that. So annoying to keep having to switch controllers or batteries. I docked off the star for that. Also, it took a few minutes to figure out how it works because the instructions were lacking (read: there weren't any in the box I got).
customer_reviews.author: Scarlet Rain

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I saved a few bucks by getting a used one through Amazon warehouse and after returning the first one, I'm very happy with it. It charges both at the same time and the indicator light stays green once fully charged. There are 2 battery packs and 2 back replacements in the pack so they controllers can be charged wirelessly.
customer_reviews.author: katie palmer

customer_reviews.title: No more missing rechargeable batteries!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I was getting so tired of my kids losing rechargeable batteries and I almost resorted to a wired controller. This was cheap enough to try, didn’t expect too much. Boy, what a game changer (pun intended). It can be hard to tell if they are seated correctly, but it lights up when it’s charging, so no big deal. We now always have fully charged controllers available when we want to play, and we have a specific place to put them when we are done.
customer_reviews.author: S. Marion

customer_reviews.title: Great...until it couldn’t go the distance. After 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for awhile but now only one side is working so this is quite inconvenient. I had this for 4 months until this happened. It was not dropped or struck in anyway so it appears that it just got tired. I can wiggle a controller in there to get it to function but the connection on the charger doesn’t sit right anymore making this side non efficient or working as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Need to have!
customer_reviews.text: So happy I purchased this item! After buying packs of batteries and spending easily over $100 over the years, we ended up buying this for $20 and it’s so worth it! The station can either hold both controllers or charge them, it’s up to you so it’s a convenient spot to have them be safe too. Overall, I am very happy we purchased this and it has gotten its use already!
customer_reviews.author: Abbey

customer_reviews.title: Brittle plastics, handle with care
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Plastics are cheap and brittle, the tab on one of the replacement doors was bent and broke off as soon as it was touched making it useless. If I get the time I will try to find a way to glue it back together and reinforce the tab and hope it holds.The other one works ok. You have to fiddle with the positioning to get the contacts to touch. But when they touch it charges like it should. Batteries seem of good quality and hold a charge for as long as I usually play a game.
customer_reviews.author: NCDesmo

customer_reviews.title: Broken after a month
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for a month now and it shocked and broke completely don’t get it it’s a piece of garbage
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Best rechargeable solution available!
customer_reviews.text: The best part of this product is the low price! There are a few caveats. You gain rechargeable battery packs, so you don't have to fuss with batteries or keeping the controller plugged in. On the other hand, you don't have the ability to charge the controller with the wire, so if your controller dies mid-play session, you're pretty much stuck using a wire. With this dock in particular, it's hard to charge the packs without a controller. You do have to deal with that, but otherwise, this product is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Jarred Ofiana

customer_reviews.title: Great value, long lasting charge
customer_reviews.text: Great set of batteries, battery life is around 6-8 hours per charge, love that you don’t need to connect anything just sit your controller over the base, charges in less than 2 hours from zero to full, the included covers fit perfectly on the controller so far I have charged it over 100 times and keeps working great
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Contreras

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great.
customer_reviews.text: For the price and accessibility of charging, this product is great. The amount of batteries I have saved on and all I have to do is just set the controller on the station. Only downfall is they don't sell replaceable battery packs. I am on my second one but the first battery packs lasted a year and a half. Still didn't feel bad buying another one for this price and longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Thayne

customer_reviews.title: When control is changing lights stay on.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Will update if anything changes UPDATE.... This works as its supposed to. But it's hard to get it on in the right position. You have to sometimes wiggle it around. It also dies fairly quick. The lights stay on both a big red or green light. Only way to turn it off is to take off controllers.
customer_reviews.author: airel

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Was nervous this wouldn't last very long, but to my surprise, this has lasted quite a while. The dual charging is easy to use and you simply push slightly for it to start charging the controllers. It lights up red when charging a low battery and turns green when full charged.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Get the Charge & Play Station!
customer_reviews.text: The only dislike about this particular charging station is the rechargable batteries & how you are not able to charge as you play (or just plain use to navigate dashboard) once battery drains. I use one controller for PC gaming and the other for Xbox, its an inconvenience but you still can plug straight to controller if they both happen to die at same time.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Way better charger than most you find. The batteries are a good fit on the controller. The charging station is spring loaded. You set the controller on port and push down and it locks in charging mode and a red light appears. When fully charged it will show green. You then push on remote and it raises to disconnect charge.
customer_reviews.author: Corbin W.

customer_reviews.title: One dead battery in the package
customer_reviews.text: I decided to take advantage of the same day shipping to have the Xbox One up and running with wireless remotes on Christmas morning. I put the batteries in the controllers and only one would charge. So it is off to Walmart I go the middle of the night to buy a 2-pack of "reliable" Xbox batteries. Beware the lure of delivery by 10PM. This kit had decent reviews. The charger works ok with the new batteries. You have to set them on there just right so that the charging light shows the status of charging. It has a sort of push down activation like a toaster.
customer_reviews.author: William L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Battery Life / Charger Decent
customer_reviews.text: I've had this charger for nearly a year now. The batteries still last a long time. Currently off work on disability stuck on bedrest. Lasted 8 hours straight with a turtle beach headset. 12+ hours straight no headset. Don't judge me. The only problem is that the controllers don't always seat properly. You have to fidget with it just a little sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Day Yandle

customer_reviews.title: Good, basic charging station.
customer_reviews.text: Good, basic, xbox one controller battery charging station. Can be a little tricky since you must a set the controller on their just right or the batteries don't charge. Some batteries don't charge well on this docking station due to size and shape. I recommend the Power A batteries for the xbox elite wireless controller if you're having any issues.
customer_reviews.author: PRSoldier

customer_reviews.title: Say good bye to your batteries
customer_reviews.text: This is an excelent product to use with your XBOX controllers because you won't need to change your batteries anymore. Is very simpley to use and the color indicators are excelent to know if they are charging or they are already charged. Also you can use with two controllers at the same time. Excelent. I recommended
customer_reviews.author: Fabian

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Good
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well and the charge seems to last longer than expected. Only dislike is that the pressing down of the controllers on the dock to engage the charging is rather flimsy which means that it's easy enough for you to set the controller on it and the controller not be lined up and therefore not charge. However, it only takes a few extra seconds to make sure it's on there correctly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bartz

customer_reviews.title: Great chafing station, good batt life, fits elite controller
customer_reviews.text: Great changing station. Dinging one star, since the battery life isn’t as great as the Xbox branded batteries they are replacing. But I still get quite a few hours out of them before needing to recharge, the charging station fits my Xbox elite controller (with some juggling to get it to seat properly) and it’s nice not to have to plug in the controllers every time to charge the.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid and quick charging!
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these, including one that I bought just over two years ago, now. They've worked great. I keep one out in the living room for that Xbox One and another in the master bedroom so I can keep a controller in there for that one, too. If I ever need a 3rd, I'll buy one again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Swags

customer_reviews.title: Finicky
customer_reviews.text: These charged well and the batteries lasted for a lot of gameplay, but the getting the base and controllers to line up was a hassle. It was too finicky to get a good connection without messing with it 10 times. I only suffered through this for about a month before moving on.
customer_reviews.author: RastaCC

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for Energizer brand rechargeable Xbox One Controller batteries and charging base.
customer_reviews.text: This replaces my Energizer brand batteries and base which lasted 4.5 years. The old batteries would not hold a charge for very long. These seem to work well. You have to make sure the controllers click into the base and the red charging light comes on. The light will change to green when fully charged. I hope they last as long as the Energizer brand. The were $5 cheaper. Arrived one day late.
customer_reviews.author: J. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Save your money on batteries and buy this charging station!
customer_reviews.text: Great charging station for Xbox one controllers! This set up comes with batteries and the charging station. The batteries last a long time and I haven't had any issues with it not lasting a playing session. When you're done, put your controllers back on the charger and you're good to go. No more buying batteries. Save the money you're spending on AA's and buy this charging station!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan L. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great Inexpensive charger
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is pretty good it will make it through 6-8 hours of gaming. My only complaint is the way the controller sits on the charger is very finicky. You have to sometimes play with the controller to get it to charge but once properly seated it charges fast. Not so much a complaint but a gripe is that the charge lights on the bottom of the device are very bright I wish there was a way to turn off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well but a little finicky
customer_reviews.text: This unit works well .. just be aware to depress the plastic down before you place the controller on there .. if you have a rubber / silicone cover on the controller you might have to play with it a little to get the contacts lined up
customer_reviews.author: Drakisback

customer_reviews.title: Became a pain in the neck
customer_reviews.text: Contact gets lost over time and it eventually becomes necessary to surgically work on positioning it until the light goes on. Even then it starts flashing and you don’t know if it’s charging or malfunctioning until the green light comes on... which it often doesn’t.
customer_reviews.author: GV

customer_reviews.title: Great item for a cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: I got this because it was able to do 2 remotes at once which is just what I needed so that if im on my Xbox the one for me PC is charging and when im done with the Xbox I can just place it up and grab the on for the PC and go to town on PC gaming without having to worry about plugging the remote in like I had to for years with my old setup.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: wasn't really easy to set the remotes onto the charging bay
customer_reviews.text: It was ok when it worked, wasn't really easy to set the remotes onto the charging bay. Then after 5 months it stopped working all together.
customer_reviews.author: yourpersonalstylist

customer_reviews.title: Batteries starter to fail after very short use time.
customer_reviews.text: I thought something was wrong with my Xbox because after a short period of time, controllers wouldn’t randomly disconnect and reconnect. I thought maybe the batteries just weren’t holding a charge, so I bought another unit just to get the new batteries. After having the same issues I looked at the reviews and saw I was not alone. I saw the Microsoft branded docking station on sale so now I’m buying those. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Looks sleek at night! Does the job well.
customer_reviews.text: It works great! I love that it has LED colors. Red when it's charging. Green when it's fully charged. The only downside is that you have to make sure they are completely adjusted for it to charged. Make sure the light turns on! That's how you know it's charging.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Great Charging Station
customer_reviews.text: I got this charging station for my husband for Christmas and I like how you can click it down to use it so that way it does not waste electricity when it is not in use. I Like how you can see if it is fully charged by it being red or green. It is very easy to use and the charge lasts for a long time! I have not let a controller die but I do know it lasts for at least 3-4 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Kailin Walker

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but not 100% intuitive.
customer_reviews.text: The "push down to charge" feature seems to be largely an unnecessary design decision. There are many other dock-chargers that charge upon contact. That would have been a better design. That said, for the price, this is an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: zunami

customer_reviews.title: Aerodynamically challenged
customer_reviews.text: Good solution for charging. Comes with two batteries and two battery doors for controller. It's a bit unfortunate that battery doors only come in black as it looks slightly out of place on white controller. If battery doors also came in white, it would be straight 5*.
customer_reviews.author: Medo

customer_reviews.title: Great charging, a little hard to set the controller correctly.
customer_reviews.text: The charger does its job and charges the controllers with the included battery packs. The instructions were limited but otherwise good. Just now and then the controller doesn't fit exactly right and doesn't charge.
customer_reviews.author: mgoldman

customer_reviews.title: So far - so good. Battery life is excellent ...
customer_reviews.text: So far - so good. Battery life is excellent and for the price, much better than paying the cost of using AA batteries. A little tricky to get them seated properly for charging, but not a big deal. Also, one of the battery covers does not fit as well as it should. Again, it's workable though.
customer_reviews.author: DrCoop

customer_reviews.title: Proprietary power, not Lithium (it is NiMh)
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be a Lithium rechargeable pack, but it is NiMh instead, which is a bummer. It also has 5Volt 1amp power input, BUT it doesn’t use any kind of USB and instead an old school power brick with a barrel connector, which I kind of hate because some day it will be lost.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: When I bought it I saw there’s one that connects to the Xbox it self right next to the disc place which is way better you guys should check it out before getting this product I believe it’s the same price but anyways the charger and everything is very good and came quick
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Pays for itself
customer_reviews.text: I like that it charges my kids remote without having to remove batteries. Have been using it for a few months without issues. Batteries are an endless issue in this wireless world, this device paid for itself in one month.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur P Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for 3 weeks and they're already giving me issues. Even on full charge the controller randomly cuts out in the middle of the game. One of the batteries kept cutting off and wouldn't turn on at all afterwards. The other is still working but that one cuts off too. Will keep using them for now and update if I have other issues, due to quarantine I have no choice and I dont want to keep buying AAs.
customer_reviews.author: Imrul Hassan

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. Seems a little cheaply
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Seems a little cheaply, but the design is good and it gets the job done. I would've preferred not to use the modified back cover with the charging terminals, but it doesn't get in the way of my gaming, and is actually pretty convenient. It was just slightly difficult to snap the battery and cover on, but no big deal. I'll keep it, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: DownToEarth

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Great charging dock for the Xbox One controllers. Battery life is decent and it's easy to rest the controllers on the dock. Only issue is that one of the batter covers doesn't like to stay in place and seems a bit loose, other than that no complaints and works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Hotsauce

customer_reviews.title: They work, that’s about it..
customer_reviews.text: They work. and they will save you Money on batteries, but the quality is below average. Plastic battery cover broke within 1 week. Batteries last about 1 year before you constantly have to switch them out. Be prepared to buy another one of these after 1 year of use
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Out of many chargers I have own this is the best one. Controllers can't move out of place when chargering and batteries last awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Willard Weidman jr

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought energizer charger before this and cant compare. This amazon charging station is much better than Energizer. Battery last long and is a piece of cake to put on stand and charge. Edit: the long term test show that energizer still working and amazon only one battery still working.
customer_reviews.author: Paulo Melo

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: We were like “battery dealers” for our little “battery junkies”. Aka our kids were addicted to batteries and I am soo happy we bought remote chargers so we don’t have to deal with them teaming batteries out of the tv remotes.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend this item to any Xbox gamer who has a ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely recommend this item to any Xbox gamer who has a lot of controllers. These batteries work well and when charging the LED light displays red when battery is low and green when its done. Its so cool. lol I'm nerding out xD I like how it also functions as a stand to hold my controllers without charging so when I need a controller I can easily grab it and start playing without worry of another controller dying.
customer_reviews.author: Alybean♡

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective for short game play.
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky to get the batter cover on, but so far it’s doing wonderful for my two kids (6,8) who play games regularly. We don’t go past 2 hours of gaming so not sure it helps people who go past that. They regularly put the controllers back on the charger. It’s looks flimsy but it gets the job done for what we need and that’s to cut down on batteries!
customer_reviews.author: Danidactyl

customer_reviews.title: Charges do not last unfortunately.
customer_reviews.text: Original batteries were old enough decided to this charge deck since I do game a lot and stream as well. batteries only last about 4 hours when fully charge at green and have to constantly alternate. The ONE S controller with the microsoft battery last about two days. It's a pain when recording or streaming to have to change controllers especially during multiplayer lol. I'm sorry but I can't recommend this charge deck. If I were able to get a refund a would but too late for that.
customer_reviews.author: manny

customer_reviews.title: Works good for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Batteries last a while for what I use it for. The quality of the batteries and battery door are excellent! The charger on the other hand is cheap! Charges the batteries and lets you know when charged. However, the build quality is very very cheap. Takes a bit of work to get the controllers and chargers to line up to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cute and functional device.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use and it's pretty compact so doesn't throw off the whole room. I leave my controllers docked when not in use so not sure how long it takes to full charge but the packs haven't died while in use yet so that's good! Lol. Pretty cute and functional device.
customer_reviews.author: Savaj Buys

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Dual Charging Station for Xbox One, Xbox One Standard, And Xbox One Elite Controllers - Black
feature_bullets: Charging station charges 2 controllers at the same time
Compatible with Xbox One S, Xbox One standard, and Xbox One elite controllers
Requires 2.5 hours for a full charge; push controller down to charge and click up to release controller
Includes 1 charging dock and 2 battery packs
LED indicator light lets you know when charge is in process/complete (red light indicates charging, green light indicates a full charge)
Backed by an AmazonBasics limited oneyear warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,287 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
